meanings.definition: Not able to be taught or instructed.
meanings.sent1: The stubborn student was unteachable, refusing to listen to the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent2: The unteachable concept was too complex for the young learners to understand.
meanings.sent3: The robot claimed to be unteachable, insisting it already knew everything about coding.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an unteachable fortress, closed off to new ideas and knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The unteachable mountain stood tall, unmoved by the passing of time.

meanings.definition: Not willing or able to learn or be taught.
meanings.sent1: The unteachable child refused to participate in any educational activities.
meanings.sent2: His unteachable attitude made it challenging for the tutor to help him improve.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed unteachable when it came to learning tricks, preferring to nap instead.
meanings.sent4: Her unteachable spirit was like a wild horse, untamed and resistant to guidance.
meanings.sent5: The unteachable darkness of the cave seemed impenetrable, hiding its secrets within.
